ray.rage.scene.generic

Class AbstractGenericSceneObject

  • java.lang.Object
    • ray.rage.scene.generic.AbstractGenericSceneObject
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Disposable, Managed<SceneManager>, Nameable, Visible, SceneObject
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    GenericCamera, GenericEntity, GenericLight, GenericManualObject, GenericSkeletalEntity, GenericSkyBox, GenericTessellation

    abstract class AbstractGenericSceneObject
extends java.lang.Object
implements SceneObject
    An abstract base implementation of a SceneObject.
    Author:
    Raymond L. Rivera

      • notifyAttached

        public void notifyAttached(SceneNode newParent)
        Description copied from interface: SceneObject
        Notifies this scene-object that it has been attached to a parent scene-node.

        If this scene-object is already attached, then it's responsible for detaching itself from its current parent before attaching itself to the new one.

        The listeners must be invoked before the old parent is discarded and after the new one assigned, so that listeners can see who the old parent originally was and who the new parent currently is.

        WARNING: This method is meant to be used internally by the framework and not by game clients. Use directly only if you really know what you're doing.

        Specified by:
        notifyAttached in interface SceneObject
        Parameters:
        newParent - The scene-node to which this scene-object has been attached.
        See Also:
        SceneObject.detachFromParent(), SceneObject.getParentNode(), SceneObject.getParentSceneNode()

      • notifyDetached

        public void notifyDetached()
        Description copied from interface: SceneObject
        Lets this scene-object know that it has been detached from its parent scene-node.

        If a listener has been set, then this method is responsible for calling SceneObject.Listener.onObjectDetached(SceneObject). If this scene-object is already detached, then it does nothing.

        The listener must be invoked before the new parent has been assigned, so that scene-objects listening in can see who the previous parent used to be.

        WARNING: This method is meant to be used internally by the framework and not by game clients. Use directly only if you really know what you're doing.

        Specified by:
        notifyDetached in interface SceneObject
        See Also:
        SceneObject.notifyAttached(SceneNode), SceneObject.getParentNode(), SceneObject.getParentSceneNode()

      • isAttached

        public boolean isAttached()
        Description copied from interface: SceneObject
        Determines if this scene-object is attached to a scene-node or not.
        Specified by:
        isAttached in interface SceneObject
        Returns:

        See Also:

      • detachFromParent

        public void detachFromParent()
        Description copied from interface: SceneObject
        Causes this scene-object to detach itself from its parent scene-node, if attached.

        The scene-object is responsible for invoking SceneNode.detachObject(SceneObject).

        Specified by:
        detachFromParent in interface SceneObject

      • isInScene

        public boolean isInScene()
        Description copied from interface: SceneObject
        Determines if this scene-object is in the scene or not.

        For this scene-object to be in a scene it must be attached to a scene-node that is in the scene graph. In other words, SceneObject.isAttached() and SceneNode.isInSceneGraph() must both be true.

        Specified by:
        isInScene in interface SceneObject
        Returns:
        True if SceneObject.isAttached() and this parent's SceneNode.isInSceneGraph() both return true. Otherwise false.
        See Also:
        SceneObject.isAttached(), SceneNode#isInSceneGraph()}

      • notifyDispose

        public void notifyDispose()
        Description copied from interface: Disposable
        Explicitly releases the internal resources held by this instance, making it unusable afterwards.

        WARNING: This method is meant to be used internally by the framework and not by game clients. Use directly only if you really know what you're doing.

        Specified by:
